entry.title: Combined summary - Wireshark plug-in for Lightning Network(BOLT) protocol
entry.summary: The Nayuta team is currently working on a Wireshark plug-in for the Lightning Network's BOLT protocol that can decode some BOLT messages. This software is compatible with Nayuta's implementation (ptarmigan) and Ã‰clair. To make interoperability testing less time-consuming, they propose a compile option that enables output key information files for every implementation. This will allow people to see communication logs of BOLT messages in the same format (.pcap), making it useful for interoperability tests.Key rotation support has already been implemented in lightning-dissector, and the ~/.lightning/keys.log file should contain a few recent sk to decrypt .pcap that contains both messages before and after key rotation. Olaoluwa Osuntokun thinks this is a great first step towards creating canned protocol transcripts for other implementations to assert their responses against. Finally, there was a discussion regarding creating canned protocol transcripts for other implementations to assert their responses against, and a proposal was made to add an option to write out either plaintext messages or final derived read/write secrets to disk. The current design is provisional, and any opinions are welcome.
